intro: Stachytarpheta radlkoferiana, commonly known as the red mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its striking red bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in whorled inflorescences, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade. Stachytarpheta radlkoferiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
